programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Smiler comes face to face with the woman of his dreams and promptly sweeps her off her feet - on to the back of his tandem, and Barry resolves to throw caution to the wind and show his affection for Glenda. Roy Clarke's long-running comedy, starring Jean Alexander, Thora Hird and Stephen Lewis alongside stalwarts Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway: Private Investigators

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Fresh DNA tests on an unidentified body found in 1996 reveal a family link to a Home Office fingerprint analyst, who has not seen her brother since she was seven, when he brought her over to the UK from their home country of Albania. The victim had been working as a police interpreter - and the motive seems clear when it turns out his last assignment was translating for a witness in a murder trial against a notorious Albanian criminal. Meanwhile, Gerry embarks on a French cookery course, but the language barrier results in a rather surprising date. Amanda Redman and Dennis Waterman star

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Already upset after demanding that Sally provide proof of Paul's infidelity, Trudi's mood is worsened by Richard trying to charm her back. Hari is furious when Siobhan does not make it to the clinic, where she knows her secret pregnancy would be revealed, and Jessica is unfulfilled following her liaisons with both Stella and her boss, Simon. Katie, however, suggests her symptoms point to her being in love

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack and Strickland form an unlikely alliance that sees them break the rules to find out why a British soldier died while taking part in a Ministry of Defence medical trial. With three of the man's colleagues now suffering from psychological, drink or memory problems, the team considers whether he died as a result of the experiment, or if he was a victim of a cover-up by the Army

programme.title: Smother

Monika embraces her gothic maximalist signature style to renovate her classic salon with a unique charm and starts with a black paint job. Tom has the challenge of modernising an industrial salon and giving a fresh edge to the rugged and characterful interior. The owners of a high-end salon that aims to deliver a luxury experience asked Jack for a Scandi makeover but he decides to take it one step further with a style he calls 'Japandi'

programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse for Amy and Howie finally learns the real reason behind the crash. Phil convinces Sharon to host a community boxing match but it could mean trouble for Zack. Suki makes a shocking discovery

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Edith Bowman explore Ballycastle's Ould Lammas Fair, finding out how Venezuelan street food made it to Northern Ireland. They also learn how to make money go further when it comes to meat and Colin introduces Edith to Yellowman and dulce. Ryan Hand is in Armagh on the hunt for a healthy ready meal and chef Suzie Lee finds a delicious fishy surprise in Lough Neagh.

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: Team members inspect an oil tanker the size of two football pitches, which must be examined inch by inch before it is allowed to set sail. With the potential to carry enough crude oil to power a third of the country for a day it is vital they do not miss anything that could mean a disaster in the event of a spillage. Meanwhile, a second team is called out to repair a vital piece of equipment on a cargo ferry that is holding up the transport of vital supplies to a nearby island

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day four from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of John Higgins v David Grace and the start of Judd Trump v Anthony McGill, both in the first round. Trump was a runner-up to Ronnie O'Sullivan last year, but faces a tough opener against the 2020 semi-finalist

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ruby Bhogal, Ed Byrne, Ingrid Oliver and Matthew Pinsent test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Nina Wadia was brought up near the coast in Hong Kong and has fond recollections of her time by the water, so her stay at the B&B is a chance to reminisce on her favourite memories of the seaside. However, the actress and comedian doesn't get to relax and is put to work bringing in the catch of the day - lobster. All that hard graft can't go to waste, because she's taught by chef Alex how to cook a lobster linguine with wild garlic to celebrate the fresh catch. The next day offers her the opportunity to make chocolate truffles with a local chocolatier

programme.title: Jay's Yorkshire Workshop
programme.desc: Jules and Jackie come to the workshop to tell Jay Blades about their 12-year-old son Henry, who saved Jules's life when the pair were on a run in the countryside. Jules collapsed suddenly with a heart attack, and Henry administered CPR and called the emergency services. His quick thinking and calm actions saved his dad's life. Ciaran goes all out for his team's final build, with an aeroplane cabin-style gaming chair, complete with surrounding shelves and even a fridge for Henry. Jay then crosses Bradford to Thorpe Edge, where he meets Angela. She wants to nominate Brenda, who runs a non-profit furniture service that helps local people in need

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the factory making 432 million crumpets every year, where quality controller Stuart Jones shows him the speciality flour that includes 13 varieties of wheat. Cherry Healey learns the science of how to make the perfect batter for pancakes and visits a factory in Manchester that makes another British favourite - Eccles cakes, which are shipped all over the world. Historian Ruth Goodman reveals the long journey of how crumpets got their rise and eventually their bubbles, and traces the history of our obsession with toasting our baked goods

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: When an experienced hiker fails to return from the top of a mountain on Skye, a multi-agency response involving the police, mountain rescue and the coastguard is launched. In Glencoe, a campervan driver reports his windscreen has been shattered by what he believes to be a bullet, while a drugs warrant in Dingwall exposes a concealed attic containing evidence of a cannabis-growing operation

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: When Ashley leaves a mess in Gordon's sock drawer, she makes an impromptu trip to Costco with Colin, Megan and her mother to buy Gordon some new furniture

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from day four at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring matches from the first round

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights of a first-round match from day four at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Murder in Mayfair
programme.desc: Reporter Nawal Al-Maghafi investigates the murder of Norwegian student Martine Vik Magnussen in 2008, who was killed in a flat near Mayfair after a night out. Al-Maghafi seeks answers from the only suspect, Farouk Abdulhak, the son of a Yemeni billionaire who, hours after Magnussen's death fled the UK to Yemen, and uncovering how money, political power and Yemeni law protected Farouk once he absconded to Yemen, which has no extradition treaty with the UK

programme.title: Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Tattoo artist Alex and social worker Amy live in Sunderland and have five children under the age of five, including identical triplets. They anticipate that their Christian faith, family and community can help them juggle a chaotic home-life now that they're both back to work and the toddlers are getting more and more active

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon invites his 11 contenders to Anglesey, north Wales, to test their raw skills and pure talent. After an expert masterclass on seaweed, the teams must precisely identify and harvest samples of the sustainable crop. Up against the tides, they need to traverse the rocks, to prove they can follow instructions. Next, Gordon tests the contenders' ability to run a business in Wales' glorious 'Little Italy' by the sea, Portmeirion. He asks the teams to create and sell pizzas to locals and tourists - whichever team takes the most money wins. Finally, it's crunch-time as the contenders come face to face with the acerbic chef

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A greyhound is brought in to give blood for the 15th time, meaning he has helped save the lives of around 60 other pets. Other patients include a St Bernard-cross that has broken its leg on a walk and a cockapoo in after being sick for an hour.

programme.desc: Coverage of the morning session on day five from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Jack Lisowski's first-round match against a qualifier and the start of Kyren Wilson's. programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day five from the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Judd Trump's first-round match against a qualifier and the start of Mark Selby's match. Selby and Trump claimed victories over Jamie Jones and Hossein Vafaei at this stage last year and will be expecting to progress once again

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ruby Bhogal, Ed Byrne, Ingrid Oliver and Matthew Pinsent test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Britain's fastest ever sprinter Linford Christie checks in the B&B, hoping to make quick work of the daily tasks. The sporting legend takes a break from his athletics coaching to reflect on his career, as well as embracing the itinerary the B&B team has set him. Among other experiences, he discovers the art of beekeeping and tests the waters off the Causeway Coast, having recently learned to swim

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Two-part programme exploring the history of both the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland and examining the rich culture and troubled past. In the first episode, Simon arrives by ferry in Co Wexford and travels along the coast, joining the thousands who try to climb the sacred mountain of Croagh Patrick. He crosses the border to visit Crom Castle and Londonderry, before journeying to the northernmost point at Malin Head

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Interior designer Banjo Beale and his team of tradespeople update a crumbling bothy on the small island of Ulva, which locals want to rent out to visitors. With no power, water or easy access, Banjo has his work cut out, but the help of handyman Tom, painter Lisa, and his husband Ro enable him to embark on his most challenging design brief to date

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The search for Wales' Home of the Year 2022 continues in mid-Wales with visits to a period property near Abergavenny, a Victorian manor house in Aberystwyth and a contemporary conversion outside Cardigan. The judges are led by presenter Owain Wyn Evans, with interior designer Mandy Watkins and architect Glen Thomas, who score the properties out of 10 on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Congenital heart surgeon Osama Jaber must perform lifesaving surgery on 15-day-old baby Callie-Mae, who was born with the two large arteries of her heart, the aorta and the pulmonary, in the wrong positions, meaning her body is not getting enough oxygenated blood. Neurosurgeon Kenan Deniz operates on 30-year-old Sam, who suffers from debilitating headaches, as she was born with a condition where the lower part of the brain pushes down onto her spine, putting pressure on the brainstem and spinal cord

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: Lance is persuaded to try hypnotherapy for an awkward affliction and old enemies are sniffing around as Lance and Andy start finding some decent items

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from day five, featuring first-round matches at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights of a first-round match from day five at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Two years ago, patient Karl sustained a brain injury after falling downstairs, as a result of which surgeons had to leave a portion of his skull missing to stop his brain from swelling. Today, neurosurgeon Ryan Mathew intends to rebuild his skull - but at the moment, a hospital bed cannot be found. Meanwhile, consultant Sheila Fraser removes a tumour believed to be the size of a football from a patient's abdomen and a seven-year-old has metal pins removed from his legs, now his broken limbs have healed

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Many hands make light work as Amanda Holden and Alan Carr invite local friends Fabrizio, Maria Pia and Carlos over for a plastering party, but things soon get out of hand as a spillage nearly ruins their newly laid terrazzo floor. On a shopping trek in the coastal city of Trapani, Amanda seeks modern soft furnishings for the living room, while Alan hunts for antique knick-knacks in the old town. Both reunite to style the newly designed space and reveal their labour of love, aka Casa Alamanda, to their Sicilian family

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: An inherited 1950s moped and a hand-cranked butter churn barrel that brings back fond memories are among the items transformed. Sabrina Grant hosts

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple looking for a home by the sea in Devon or Dorset, and rides a three-wheeled bicycle with a scheme which helps people to explore the area's coastline

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more people bring their items to the dealers to sell. First in is Billy with a large two-seater spaceship from the funfair, followed by Nyree with a French decanter she found in a charity shop. Next in is Lee with a 1970s pay phone in original and working condition and Kevin with a Hornby train set he has owned for 60 years. Finally, Carole enters hoping luck is on her side as she tries to sell her tombola machine

programme.title: Between the Covers
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by comedians Alan Davies and Ivo Graham and actresses Samantha Bond and Sunetra Sarker, who champion their favourite books. The guests also review this week's two book club choices, which are The Space Between Us by Doug Johnstone and Lullaby by Leila Slimani

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A woman suspects a workman in her garden is guilty of a crime and a council witness the worst fly-tipper they've ever seen. Plus a burglar has a painful encounter with a tree

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls, the day's talking points and interviews on today's news

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the afternoon session on day six at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Mark Selby v Matthew Selt in the first round, and the start of the second-round contest between Luca Brecel and Mark Williams. Selby has won the title on four occasions, with the most recent of those triumphs coming two years ago, when he overcame Shaun Murphy in the final

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ruby Bhogal, Ed Byrne, Ingrid Oliver and Matthew Pinsent test their general knowledge skills ahead of Friday's final, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: The latest guest at the B&B is actor Larry Lamb, who is no stranger to Northern Ireland. During Larry's stay he meets a special Japanese herd who help provide the star ingredient for the evening meal, a twist on the classic beef wellington with a Northern Irish wagyu steak, served with smoked mash and red cabbage. Sharon and driver Rory take Larry to a local spot he's never visited before - the picturesque seaside town of Ballycastle. Before checking out, chef Alex takes Larry under his wing baking a unique take on a Northern Irish soda bread, with bacon and eggs

programme.title: Ireland with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Part two of two. The second leg of Simon's journey begins at the Giant's Causeway, before visiting a kelp farm on Rathlin Island. He heads to the Dark Hedges in Co Antrim, one of the filming locations from Game of Thrones, and visits Belfast for the July 12 parades, discovering how the event has divided the city. He also learns more about Oliver Cromwell's influence on Ireland, attends the Gaze film festival, and meets monkeys at an animal sanctuary in the Wicklow mountains

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Kwesi, 70, checks in to the hotel in north Wales in the hope of meeting his daughter Ruth, who was adopted at birth. Childhood friends Noah and Matt haven't seen each other for more than 12 years, but want to reconnect after an often-difficult teenage relationship. And a group of women who became the first all-female relay expedition to the North Pole hope to have a long-awaited reunion. Alex Jones presents

programme.title: Why Buildings Collapse
programme.desc: Documentary examining the collapse of the Champlain Towers South apartment building in Miami in 2021, and looking at the implications for other buildings around the world. The programme explores the factors that might have led to the collapse, and also looks to the future to ask what lessons can be learnt from this disaster

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: Loyiso Gola introduces fellow comedians Scott Bennett and Helen Bauer to the stage of the legendary Hammersmith venue

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Action from day six at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring first and second-round matches

programme.title: Snooker: World Championship Extra
programme.desc: Extended highlights from a match on day six of the tournament at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield

programme.title: We Need to Talk About Cosby
programme.desc: W Kamau Bell's documentary reveals how after Bill Cosby struck gold with The Cosby Show, a genre-defining family sitcom and monument to black excellence, he began leveraging his growing power inside the entertainment industry

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Dangerous politics and turbulent love shock the painter's world - after conducting a short affair with Leon Trotsky, Diego's political mentor, Frida finally achieves her own solo exhibition in Europe. But all does not go according to plan, and she returns to Mexico to find that Diego wants a divorce

programme.title: Saved and Remade
programme.desc: A vintage car - once a father-and-son project but now rusting away - and a cake stand with huge sentimental value are among the objects transformed

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day four at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusions of Robert Milkins v Joe Perry and Gary Wilson v Elliot Slessor in the first round. Milkins has been a professional since 1995, but his last appearance in the main draw was in 2018, when he reached the second round. Wilson was a semi-finalist in 2019, but that is the only occasion he has progressed beyond this stage

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: The historian draws on the lives of Winston Churchill and George Orwell, who created the hero Winston Smith in his novel 1984. These men had a huge personal impact on the historian and touched many of the key events of the 20th century, including the World Wars and the Depression

programme.title: Chris Packham: In Search of the Lost Girl
programme.desc: The presenter returns to Sumatra, where 20 years previously he photographed a member of a nomadic hunter gatherer tribe and was struck by how her people lived in perfect harmony with their environment. He tries to track her down despite having no clues to her identity or whereabouts. However, he discovers the country has been devastated by deforestation in the intervening years, while many members of the tribe have been killed

programme.title: Measuring Mass: The Last Artefact
programme.desc: A hi-tech vault just outside Paris is the home of the kilogram, a small metallic cylinder that is used as the base unit of mass - it is the item against which everything else is measured. But over time, this small hunk of metal has mysteriously eroded by the weight of an eyelash, a change that could have dire consequences. This documentary tells the story of the kilogram, and follows a group of scientists as they try to redefine the weight of the world

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Helen Czerski examines the complexities of colour, including what it is, how it works, and how it has written the story of the planet. In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them

programme.title: A History of Britain by Simon Schama
programme.desc: The historian draws on the lives of Winston Churchill and George Orwell, who created the hero Winston Smith in his novel 1984. These men had a huge personal impact on the historian and touched many of the key events of the 20th century, including the World Wars and the Depression

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day five at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Kyren Wilson v Ryan Day and the start of Shaun Murphy v Si Jiahui, both in the first round. Wilson, a runner-up in 2020, claimed a hard-fought 10-8 victory over 2016 finalist Ding Junhui at this stage last year, while Murphy suffered a defeat by the same score line at the hands of Stephen Maguire and now faces the player who eliminated him at this stage of the 2021 UK Championship

programme.title: Alex Higgins: The People's Champion
programme.desc: James Nesbitt narrates a look back at the often controversial life of the two-time world snooker champion, who was widely regarded as one of the most naturally gifted players in the history of his sport, but whose brilliance was flawed by his demons. With contributions by members of his family, as well as fellow snooker greats Jimmy White, Ronnie O'Sullivan, Steve Davis and Dennis Taylor

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc: Mini-series based on the novel by John McGahern, following a man growing old among a family who try to live through tragic circumstances. Moran is an overbearing father who believes himself to be benevolent, but the death of his wife makes his relationship with his five children increasingly difficult. Drama, starring Tony Doyle and Susan Lynch

programme.title: Amongst Women
programme.desc: Maggie is reunited with Luke in London and meets her first love, while back at Great Meadow, Moran's other daughters confront their futures

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm
programme.desc: Restoration work on the miller's cottage continues, but across the lane building works at the mill grind to halt as the planning authorities investigate local objections to Griff Rhys Jones's plans. Meanwhile, the comedian makes plans for a music festival

programme.title: The Joy of Winning
programme.desc: A witty, mind-expanding guide in which Hannah Fry unlocks the essential strategies a person needs to get what they want - to win more of the time. The mathematician also hails 20th-century scientists John von Neumann and John Nash, who worked out the science of success and reveals how the same rules apply to the world's biggest problems - whether its avoiding nuclear annihilation or tackling climate change

programme.title: The Art Mysteries with Waldemar Januszczak
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak examines Gauguin's Vision After the Sermon,an epic 17th-century religious painting exploring temptation and desire. He uncovers some unusual connections with sumo wrestling, Victor Hugo's Les Miserables, and a 17-year-old girl called Madeleine

programme.title: Chris Packham: In Search of the Lost Girl
programme.desc: The presenter returns to Sumatra, where 20 years previously he photographed a member of a nomadic hunter gatherer tribe and was struck by how her people lived in perfect harmony with their environment. He tries to track her down despite having no clues to her identity or whereabouts. However, he discovers the country has been devastated by deforestation in the intervening years, while many members of the tribe have been killed

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day six at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, featuring the conclusion of Shaun Murphy v Si Jiahui in round one, and the start of a second-round contest. Murphy was a champion in 2005 and has been a runner-up on three occasions since, most recently when he was defeated by Mark Selby two years ago, but he lost to Stephen Maguire in the first round in 2022

programme.title: School for Scoundrels (1960)
programme.desc: A timid company owner is pushed around by his employees, deceived by a car salesman, humiliated by a waiter and finally loses his girlfriend to a dastardly rival. Salvation comes in the form of an unusual college dedicated to teaching students how to succeed through being manipulative and devious, and he sets about getting even with his enemies. Comedy, starring Ian Carmichael, Terry-Thomas, Alastair Sim and Janette Scott

programme.title: The Titfield Thunderbolt (1953)
programme.desc: Villagers try to save their railway branch from closure by taking it over as a public business - but the owners of the local bus company try to sabotage their plans, forcing them to resort to more underhand methods. Ealing comedy, starring Stanley Holloway, George Relph, John Gregson, Godfrey Tearle and Sid James

programme.title: Mark Kermode's Secrets of Cinema
programme.desc: The critic returns to examines more of the techniques and conventions behind classic movie genres, beginning by looking at the tropes of British comedies. Mark argues that they win laughs by tapping into the public's abiding national preoccupations, from rooting for the underdog to the subversion of class and manners, as well as the audience's fascination with comedy and crime, and pastiches and parodies that take the big beasts of Hollywood down a peg or two

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Mathematician Hannah Fry is joined by a selection of BBC science experts to investigate the British public's questions about the future, trying to discover whether people could live for ever and if there will be a cure for cancer. Hannah examines the future of transport and if it will be possible to ditch fossil fuels, looks at what the weather will be like and discovers if the planet is on the verge of another mass extinction

programme.title: Return to Pembrokeshire Farm

In the first edition, she looks for the colours that have made the earth multi-coloured, investigating the essence of sunlight, how vivid blue is formed from sulphur atoms, and why the presence of red ochre is a key sign of life. She also looks at why gold should not even exist on the surface of the planet, and the role of salt and water in shaping planet earth

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

programme.desc: A round-up of political news and events at Westminster and Holyrood

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as five more people bring their items to the dealers to sell. First in is Billy with a large two-seater spaceship from the funfair, followed by Nyree with a French decanter she found in a charity shop. programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the magazine show, with stories of interest from around the UK, plus celebrity guests in the studio

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse for Amy and Howie finally learns the real reason behind the crash. Phil convinces Sharon to host a community boxing match but it could mean trouble for Zack. Suki makes a shocking discovery

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Peter Mason from Herefordshire brings an old-fashioned ice cream maker into the Repair Shop. Once belonging to his beloved Granny Ethel, Peter hopes metal craftsman Dom can bring the sentimental kitchen curiosity back to life. David Burville takes on the challenge of restoring a Spanish barrel organ known as an organillo. Owner Carolina Urraca is hoping David can breathe new life into the instrument she loved to play when growing up with her grandmother in Spain. Audio specialist tackles the repair of Lorraine McCourt's portable record player from the 1950s. Originally a gift from her father to her mother when they were courting, the precious momento brings back memories of Lorraine's parents dancing to Nat King Cole. Finally, Malcom Jordan from Chippenham brings in a 65 year-old leather document case for Susie Fletcher to repair

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: The teams reach the halfway point and set off on their journey to the fifth checkpoint over 3,000 kilometres away on Manitoulin Island. The race is on but the pairs only have one way out of Churchill - an overnight train south followed by two buses from hell. In what could be the tightest leg so far, the teams have limited options and must use their ingenuity to gain an advantage. The current leaders struggle on with only a quarter of their budget left after splashing out on an expensive taxi in the last leg. Zainib is feeling homesick leaving her and husband Mobeen with a decision to make and Monique and Ladi try to make a quick break from the other teams. Tricia fears she may have to cut her race short after receiving some bad news from home

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: A Believer's Guide To
programme.desc: Happily married couple Saul and Shoshi hope that following Jewish marriage rituals can help them through the tough times. As young Orthodox Jews they participate in the sacred ritual of the Mikvah and sleep in separate beds for 12 days of every month

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.desc: In Paisley, crew members Gary and Peter rush to treat a patient whose heart rate is dangerously fast. programme.desc: Businesses need to adapt to different markets, so with this in mind Gordon gathers the contenders in Manchester to face their next challenges. He begins by asking them to run a 'Bottomless Brunch', hosted by some of the UK's best drag queens. He next sets out to discover who knows the fitness food market, tasking them to master product development, marketing and design. They then face a relentless Q&A from industry greats, including Olympic champion boxer Nicola Adams. Finally, it's the biggest test of all, as Gordon himself grills the contenders on their performance

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Advice for anyone considering dentistry abroad from specialist dentist Dr Rhona Eskander. Plus, an investigation into the pros and cons of medical technology

programme.title: Paramedics on Scene
programme.desc: In Paisley, crew members Gary and Peter rush to treat a patient whose heart rate is dangerously fast. They are able to stabilise him by using an old trick - bumping him down the stairs in a wheelchair, which stimulates his vagus nerve and slows his heart rate - before transporting him to hospital. In Melrose, Lee and Nadine attend a 40-year-old woman with severe Covid symptoms. She is struggling to walk, and the crew gives her oxygen in the ambulance on the way to hospital.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Manhunt: The Raoul Moat Story
programme.desc: Ten years have passed since Newcastle bodybuilder Raoul Moat went on the run after shooting his ex-girlfriend Samantha Stobbart and her new boyfriend Chris Brown, killing the latter. Nicky Campbell presents this documentary looking back at the real-life drama as it unfolded in July 2010. Archive footage combines with interviews with family members, witnesses and journalists to piece together the tragic events that gripped the nation, and only ending when Moat shot himself dead while surrounded by armed police

Sleuthing monk Cadfael is soon on the scent of the killer, boiling the corpse down to its bones to ascertain the cause of death - and finding a tiny cross that could provide a vital clue. Medieval mystery, starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Michael Culver, Julian Firth and Anthony Green

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Thomas follows a trail of duplicity and multiple murders as he investigates the disappearance of a man spirited away by an anonymous gang. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck as the private eye

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: The brother of a suspected drug-dealer dies while in custody, and his elder sibling directs his powerful lawyer to instigate a committee to investigate CI5's involvement. With the future of the division in question, Bodie and Doyle try to prove the family's drug-trade connection and the real reason behind the man's death. Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins star

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Terry agrees to protect an ex-convict who is being targeted by former partners wanting a share of money stolen during a bank heist. Meanwhile, Arthur resorts to devious tactics to obtain the location of the stashed loot first. Dennis Waterman and George Cole star

programme.title: Dempsey and Makepeace
programme.desc: The duo find themselves the target of a powerful diamond merchant, forcing Dempsey to enlist the aid of a former boxer he put behind bars

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Francesca Cumani presents coverage from the opening day of the Craven meeting at Newmarket, where the Earl of Sefton Stakes is the feature race of the day. With analysis from Jason Weaver and Kevin Blake, reports by Sally Ann Grassick and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles

programme.desc: A look back at a selection of sports covered by ITV, including horse racing, Formula One and darts

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: An Israeli minister is abducted, and the ensuing suburban siege triggers an airborne pursuit as Bodie and Doyle try to save the day. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: How traditional seaside rock is made, a process that has not changed since Victorian times. Plus, how a new fire extinguisher is saving lives around the world. Jimmy Nail narrates

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts six more contestants through their paces to see who will have the opportunity to answer 15 questions to win the prize of £1,000,000. Each player has four lifelines - Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50:50 and Ask the Host - at their disposal

programme.title: For Your Eyes Only (1981)
programme.desc: James Bond goes in search of a British weapons system aboard a sunken vessel before it falls into the hands of enemies who will use it to deactivate all Western submarines. Unfortunately, his mission is hindered by a crossbow-toting woman out to avenge her father's murder. Spy thriller, starring Roger Moore, Topol, Julian Glover, Carole Bouquet, Jill Bennett and Lynn-Holly Johnson

programme.title: Hornblower
programme.desc: Newly promoted Captain Horatio Hornblower sets out to make his mark on the world, and soon manages to capture his first enemy vessel - only to discover a peace treaty has been signed, leaving him down and out, with barely a penny to his name. Fate seems to smile on the ambitious seafarer though, when he discovers the villainous Bonaparte has reneged on the treaty. Drama based on the CS Forester novels, starring Ioan Gruffudd, Robert Lindsay, Paul McGann, Greg Wise, Lorcan Cranitch and Julia Sawalha

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Staff at Heathrow prepare for the arrival of Air Force One, and although the airport is quieter than usual, it is still a huge effort logistically to make sure things run smoothly. Meanwhile, security officer Estafania scrutinises the contents of passengers' hand luggage, as well as their face masks, and airside officer Ian has his hands full

programme.title: Heathrow: Britain's Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Terminal 3 re-opens its doors to the public 15 months into the global pandemic, with 11 Virgin flights set to take off, but teething problems threaten to delay one of the departures. It's business as usual in Terminal 5 as Passenger Experience Manager Tas is called to deal with an arriving passenger who is refusing to pay for his mandatory Covid tests, while the City of London Corporation's Animal Reception Centre have quarantined two dogs who have flown into the USA without proof of treatment for tapeworm

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie's girlfriend is critically injured in a restaurant bomb blast, prompting him to seek revenge. When it transpires the intended target was an apparently unimportant accountant, Bodie ignores Cowley's orders and begins probing the man's past. Lewis Collins stars

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Terry acts as the bodyguard for a Lebanese businessman and diplomat. However, relationships between the two are strained and when their safe house is raided by gunmen, Terry's opinion of his charge reaches a new depth. Dennis Waterman and Kenneth Griffith star

programme.title: Made in Britain
programme.desc: How a biochemist-turned-distiller is making Britain's first commercially produced rum, and what it takes to make a George Cross - Britain's highest civilian award for bravery. programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade swims into the lair of a snakehead, an aggressive Far Eastern predator that has now invaded America. He tries to ascertain whether it deserves its reputation as a 'Jack the Ripper' fish capable of killing humans, and reveals that the creature is believed to breathe air and crawl on land

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Biologist and extreme angler Jeremy Wade travels to the heart of Africa journeying along the Congo, a river shrouded in mystery and steeped in legend. While exploring the tale of Mami Wata, a spirit that is said to lure fishermen from their boats to the bottom of the river, where they are imprisoned for eternity, he discovers the truth is every bit as frightening as the myth

programme.title: George Clarke's National Trust Unlocked
programme.desc: George discovers some of the UK's most impressive historic homes, as he is granted special access to some of these extraordinary places, delving into the hidden recesses that visitors don't normally get to see. In this first episode, George's journey begins in Dorset at the UK's most exquisite example of Italianate architecture - the magnificent 17th-century Kingston Lacy. He uncovers a tale of shame and scandal on the south coast, and the beautiful Cotswold landmark - Hidcote Manor Gardens - in full bloom takes his breath away. George also mines the history of the country's last cave dwellers at one of Britain's best-kept secrets, the Rock Houses at Kinver Edge, and finally, with his husky Loki, takes a walk at spectacular Studland Bay, part of the Jurassic Coast World Heritage Site

programme.title: Live: Vanished: The Hunt for Britain's Missing People
programme.desc: Every 90 seconds someone is reported missing in the UK. Most are found within hours, many are located in a matter of days but there are some who seem to disappear, often with little or no trace. Dan Walker investigates more cases of people who have gone missing - some well known, others not, and each with a unique set of circumstances. Dan speaks directly to loved ones, families, friends, police and experts from charities

programme.title: Killer at the Crime Scene

programme.desc: The errors made by Mick Philpott that led to his arrest for causing the death of five of his children and their half-brother by setting light to his home in Derby. The programme examines how his unconvincing appearance at a press conference and ill-timed attendance of a karaoke party raised the police's suspicions - leading them to bug his hotel room and hear an incriminating conversation

programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.desc: The former Pontins bluecoat takes on a mission to persuade friends, family and the great British public about the great fun to be had at caravan parks in Britain. Here, the actor heads to Rhyl, north Wales, where he and his extended family accept accommodation in three static caravans. The EastEnders star then tries to win them all over to this type of holiday, highlighting attractions such as classic bingo at the entertainment complex and rounders on the beach. They then visit Blaenau Ffestiniog to zipline over a slate quarry, where even the grandparents take on the challenge

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: When Peppa, George, Mummy and Daddy Pig visit Madame Gazelle, they realise that a tall tree next to her home is pushing it over

programme.title: Pip and Posy

programme.title: Paw Patrol
programme.desc: When Roger's refrigerated van gets stuck in a ditch, the pups must find a way to keep the ice pops cold while they rescue the van and restart the freezer

programme.title: Went the Day Well? (1942)
programme.desc: Villagers in a remote English village eagerly help a large group of Allied troops billeted in their town, but when they realise the soldiers are disguised German paratroopers acting as the vanguard of an invasion, they must pull together to thwart the enemy. Second World War drama, directed by Alberto Cavalcanti and based on a story by Graham Greene, starring Leslie Banks, Basil Sydney, Mervyn Johns and Marie Lohr

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared (1959)
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern

programme.title: Midnight Lace (1960)
programme.desc: American heiress Kit Preston is living a life of luxury in London with her new husband, but her idyllic life is shattered when she is terrorised by strange phone calls and voices in the fog. Her husband dismisses the threats as a practical joke, but as the scary incidents and menacing calls mount it becomes clear that someone really does have it in for her. Thriller, starring Doris Day, Rex Harrison, Roddy McDowall, Hermione Baddeley and Myrna Loy

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck! (1960)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama, charting the mission to track down and eliminate the pride of the German fleet, a fearsome battleship devastating British vessels in the North Atlantic, orchestrated by a British naval officer recovering from his wife's death in an air raid. Starring Kenneth More, Dana Wynter, Laurence Naismith and Karel Stepanek

programme.title: Deep Impact (1998)
programme.desc: A TV reporter investigating a presidential misdemeanour stumbles on evidence that a comet is on a collision course with Earth, threatening the future of the human race. Meanwhile, an astronaut prepares to lead his crew on a do-or-die mission to intercept the danger. Sci-fi drama, starring Robert Duvall, Tea Leoni, Morgan Freeman and Elijah Wood

programme.title: Air Force One (1997)
programme.desc: The American president is forced to take drastic measures to save his family when their plane is hijacked by Russian terrorists demanding the release of a jailed radical general. Meanwhile, the vice president tries to manage the crisis from Washington and has to decide whether to shoot the aircraft down. Action thriller, starring Harrison Ford, Gary Oldman, Glenn Close, Dean Stockwell and William H Macy

programme.title: True History of the Kelly Gang (2019)
programme.desc: During the 19th century, Australian bushranger Ned Kelly and his gang flee from the authorities. Three-part drama based on Peter Carey's Booker prize-winning novel, starring George MacKay and Essie Davis

programme.title: And When Did You Last See Your Father? (2007)
programme.desc: A successful writer learns that his father is dying of cancer, and returns to his family home. As time passes, he looks back at his complex, confrontational relationship with his father over the years and tries to come to terms with the conflict between them. Drama, based on Blake Morrison's autobiographical book, starring Jim Broadbent and Colin Firth

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder (1965)
programme.desc: Four brothers are reunited at their mother's funeral and discover their father was swindled out of his farm and subsequently murdered. However, as they set about avenging his death and reclaiming his land, a crook frames them for killing the sheriff. Western, starring John Wayne, Dean Martin, Earl Holliman, Michael Anderson Jr, James Gregory, George Kennedy and Dennis Hopper

programme.title: Fire Down Below (1957)
programme.desc: Felix and Tony run a tramp steamer together in the West Indies, but their seemingly unshakeable friendship is tossed aside when they both fall in love with the same woman. Tony tries to undermine his rival by exposing his illegal activities, while Felix responds with deadly intent. Romantic drama, with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth (1959)
programme.desc: An explorer discovers a prehistoric monster-infested world deep beneath Earth's crust and faces a tough ordeal escaping the predatory attacks of the creatures as he tries to guide his team back to safety. Sci-fi adventure based on Jules Verne's novel, starring Pat Boone, James Mason, Arlene Dahl and Diane Baker

programme.title: K-19: The Widowmaker (2002)
programme.desc: The captain of Russia's first nuclear submarine is demoted for expressing fears that the vessel is unfit for commission. However, his anxieties prove well-founded when the reactor malfunctions, creating the possibility of a nuclear explosion the US would mistake for an attack - and potentially triggering a global conflict. Kathryn Bigelow's fact-based thriller, starring Harrison Ford, Liam Neeson and Peter Sarsgaard

programme.title: Hustlers (2019)
programme.desc: Strip club employees band together to turn the tables on their Wall Street clients, drugging stock traders and CEOs who visit the establishment then running up bills on their credit cards. Comedy crime drama, starring Jennifer Lopez, Constance Wu, Julia Stiles, Lizzo and Cardi B

programme.title: Misery (1990)
programme.desc: A successful author finds his relief at being rescued from a near-fatal car crash is severely tempered by the discovery that his saviour is a fan with psychopathic tendencies. The situation takes a turn for the worse when she discovers he has killed off her favourite character - and sets about coercing him to do a rewrite in nightmarish fashion. Oscar-winning thriller, starring James Caan, Kathy Bates and Lauren Bacall

programme.title: The Assistant (2019)
programme.desc: Jane, a young graduate, lands her dream job as a junior assistant to a commanding entertainment mogul, but over the course of one day realises her vocation has turned into a nightmare. She decides to take a stand when things take a dark turn and power is abused. Writer/director Kitty Green's drama, starring Julia Garner and Matthew Macfadyen

programme.title: Lonely Are the Brave (1962)
programme.desc: A rebellious modern-day cowboy breaks out of jail and escapes on horseback - but reckons without the relentlessness of the authorities, who give chase by car and helicopter. A dogged sheriff leads the pursuit, coming to sympathise with his quarry. Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Walter Matthau, Gena Rowlands and George Kennedy

programme.title: The Green Man (1956)
programme.desc: A professional assassin and master of disguise is assigned to murder a pompous politician - only to find his efforts hampered by a bumbling vacuum cleaner salesman. Black comedy, starring Alastair Sim, George Cole, Jill Adams and Terry-Thomas

programme.title: It Should Happen to You (1954)
programme.desc: A publicity-seeking actress with an urge to be famous comes up with a plan to make a name for herself. She rents a billboard in New York with her name and picture on it, and soon becomes an overnight sensation - despite not actually being famous for anything. Meanwhile, a wealthy playboy becomes infatuated with her, to the consternation of her film-maker boyfriend. Comedy, starring Judy Holliday, Peter Lawford and Jack Lemmon in his screen debut

programme.title: Anne of the Indies (1951)
programme.desc: A no-nonsense pirate welcomes a French captain on board her ship and promptly falls in love - unaware the charming officer has been sent by the British to capture her. Learning of the deception, she kidnaps his wife to sell as a slave. Jacques Tourneur's high-seas adventure, starring Jean Peters, Louis Jourdan, Debra Paget and Herbert Marshall

programme.title: Ghostbusters (2016)
programme.desc: When a series of supernatural disturbances occurs in New York City, two experts in the paranormal investigate, joined by a brilliant inventor who has created an array of ghost-hunting gadgets and a public transport worker whose knowledge of the city provides vital clues to the sinister cause of the ghostly activity. Reboot of the 1980s comedy franchise, starring Kristen Wiig, Melissa McCarthy, Kate McKinnon, Leslie Jones and Chris Hemsworth

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout (2018)
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt and the IMF team join forces with CIA assassin August Walker to prevent a disaster caused by mysterious arms dealer John Lark and a group of terrorists known as the Apostles. However, Hunt and his colleagues are soon pushed to their limits thanks to a face from their past. Writer/director Christopher McQuarrie's sixth entry in the action thriller saga, starring Tom Cruise and Henry Cavill

programme.title: Little Fockers (2010)
programme.desc: Nurse Greg is now the proud father of twins, but has yet to earn the respect of his wife's stern father after 10 years of marriage. The couple invite both sides of their extended family to the kids' birthday party, where Greg makes a desperate effort to finally prove his worth to his father-in-law. Comedy sequel, with Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Owen Wilson and Dustin Hoffman

programme.title: Searching (2018)
programme.desc: When his 16-year-old daughter Margot disappears from her California home, and a police investigation yields few results, David Kim decides to explore her laptop. He contacts her friends in the hope of gleaning some information regarding her location, and discovers a secret about her piano lessons that could be a vital key to the puzzle. Thriller, starring John Cho and Debra Messing

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Leah comes up with a plan to help Darren persuade Charlie to return home. Meanwhile, the Chen-Williams children are taken aback when they hear some shocking news

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.desc: Claire struggles to get hold of the year's must-have gadget for Phil's birthday. Cam gets involved in a neighbour's marital problems, while Mitchell decides it is time to toughen up. Comedy, starring Julie Bowen, Ty Burrell, Eric Stonestreet and Jesse Tyler Ferguson

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Terry tackles an old case with Jake's help to prove his mettle to his old precinct, while Adrian becomes Charles' new roommate and Amy goes on a difficult training exercise with Holt and Rosa

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Diaz enlists Peralta to help change Jeffords' disapproving opinion about her fast-moving relationship with Pimento. However, the new couple's love for each other has to be put on hold when Pimento comes to believe that someone from his past is trying to kill him

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard tells Penny he loves her, but fails to get the response he would have liked. Sheldon also finds himself competing against Star Trek: The Next Generation actor Wil Wheaton once again when the gang goes bowling - and tries to get his revenge

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to hide the fact he had dinner with Penny after she broke up with Leonard, hoping to stay friends with her. However, keeping secrets does not prove to be his strong point, and it isn't long before his deceit is exposed. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon goes to Las Vegas and does everything he can to win a large sum of money for science. Meanwhile, Penny and Bernadette take Amy shopping for a wedding dress, but her terrible choice entangles them in a web of lies

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: When Sheldon learns that his mother won't attend his wedding unless he invites his brother Georgie, he and Leonard travel to Texas to end a family feud. Meanwhile, Howard and Bernadette's children inadvertently give them, Amy and Raj conjunctivitis. Jerry O'Connell guest stars

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: In an episode inspired by Hitchcock thriller Strangers on a Train, Claire and Mitchell agree to be brutally honest with each other's partners - so Phil is informed his stand-up comedy is cringeworthy, and Cam is told his decision to wear biker shorts is unwise. Comedy, starring Julie Bowen and Jesse Tyler Ferguson

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Tired of the family's obsession with electronic gadgets, Claire and Phil declare a household challenge to see who can stay unplugged the longest. Mitch and Cameron frantically try to get Lily into the best pre-school, while Jay and Manny are concerned at the lengths to which Gloria will go to stop the neighbour's dog barking

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: When Pimento and Diaz decide to tie the knot, the squad members try to prepare the perfect wedding under Santiago's careful direction. Peralta and Gina help Pimento to find his grandmother's ruby earrings so that Diaz can wear them at the ceremony. Jason Mantzoukas guest stars

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta goes to extremes trying to impress Santiago's father at Thanksgiving dinner. Boyle is on turkey duty, and Holt helps Pimento deal with no longer being able to work for the NYPD

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard has a meeting with Colonel Williams, a representative from the US air force's department of material command, about the gyroscope he invented with Leonard and Sheldon. Penny accidentally reveals that Bernadette is pregnant to their colleagues at work. Dean Norris guest stars

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Tensions rise when the guys struggle to complete their Air Force project on time and are forced to work around the clock - leaving Sheldon fighting to stay awake. programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Raj's sister Priya visits the gang, causing tension when Leonard tries to cover up the fling he once had with her. After discovering his friend's secret, Sheldon struggles to keep quiet, leading the guys to reveal information they have all been keeping from one another

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard vows to be more self-assured around women, believing his problem attracting a girlfriend stems from a lack of confidence. An FBI agent interviews the gang to assess Howard's suitability for a team working on a new surveillance satellite. Guest starring Eliza Dushku

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: An unfriendly familiar face shows up at the casino night. Elsewhere, Imran is feeling suffocated by his mum and Zain's over protectiveness

programme.desc: Alan and Sylvie welcome their guests to the Watersedge Guest House in Barton-on-Sea, Hampshire, but an afternoon of deer-watching leaves some of them bored. Desperate to impress their fellow B&B owners, the pair host a Hawaiian barbecue, before pulling out all the stops at breakfast time

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Owners Tim and Amelia Whitaker welcome their guests to their non-star-rated boutique accommodation, Nearwater, on the south Cornish coast, and take them out on a boat for a spot of seal watching and diving. However, the sight of wet suits proves too much for one contestant, and tensions also flare over dinner when Mike and Danny are quizzed about their relationship

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Eva Buschmann hosts the competition at the Roundhouse Hotel in Weymouth, Dorset. She makes the mistake of assuming Danny Robinson and Mike Gibson are a couple, and offers them a double room with an exposed shower, but hopes a lesson in abstract art and a meal at her favourite harbour-side restaurant will win the other contestants over

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mike Gibson and Danny Robinson host their rival B&B owners at their four-star guesthouse - Homecliffe Hotel in Blackpool. The hosts take their visitors on a tram ride along the seafront and on to Madame Tussauds, but there are complaints about uncomfortable mattresses and disappointing views and the next day's breakfast fails to impress

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and air their grievances. Watersedge hosts Alan and Sylvie start the proceedings, but confront the guests who complained about their room having no en-suite facilities, before the winner is announced

programme.title: Love It or List It Australia
programme.desc: Ray and Dana's cottage in Lilyfield, Sydney, is pretty but has a disjointed feel to it. The death-defying staircase is right in the middle of the dining room and the main bathroom is also in the wrong spot, also in the dining room. Ray loathes the thought of buying and selling again, but would prefer to cut their losses and buy a new home that doesn't have them compromising on anything. Dana can see beyond the bad layout and honestly believes a renovation will dramatically improve the way the family live. They invite Andrew Winter and Neale Whitaker to offer their opinions and advice

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Phil Spencer and Kirstie Allsopp meet the Pogsons in Harrogate, North Yorkshire and offer advice to the family who are unsure whether to renovate their property or find a new home. After living in their three-bedroom house for 16 years, Carol thinks that it is time for a big change, but Andrew is adamant he is not moving house

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Tim and Rebecca receive a booking and prepare for the imminent arrival of their first paying guests. Martin and Kim take their chateau search up a gear and view the last property on their list. Paul and Karen embark on creating a cinema room in their barn, but the building looks set to collapse and their hopes of breaking even start to crumble. Angel helps to cushion the blow by upholstering a family heirloom

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets actor Sean Simons, who has bought the ruins of Cloontykilla Castle in Co Roscommon with a view to using them to create a spectacular mock 16th-century home. However, the outlandish plans - including Jacuzzis in the battlements and water-spouting gargoyles - have Kevin worried the project could become a garish nightmare, and his scepticism increases when he realises Sean has not consulted an architect. Disaster seems to be looming as the contractors grow frustrated and planning regulations are ignored, but somehow things slowly begin to take shape - until a national economic crisis plunges everything into chaos

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three young men from different walks of life are brought in to the A&E department of St George's Hospital in London, including 17-year-old Shea, who has serious stab wounds and is sent to a high dependency unit. Fellow 17-year-old Bob arrives after impaling his leg on a fence while taking a shortcut home from his boys' school, and 33-year-old James is brought in by ambulance after fainting at home

programme.title: 24 Hour Baby Hospital
programme.desc: Dundalk couple Cathy and Darren learn that their baby, who is only 20 weeks in the womb, has a very serious congenital abnormality that if left untreated will possibly be fatal. Rong Fen and Dong arrive at the Rotunda for the birth of their second baby, and a healthcare worker goes into early labour with her twin girls at just 29 weeks' gestation

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a woman who is in excruciating pain after giving birth by caesarean section just over a week ago. Even morphine is having little effect. A mother rings for help after her toddler has been ill for several days and proves difficult to wake, while a woman with a bad cough and a very high temperature is struggling to breathe

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Co Durham, heli-medics battle to keep Mick alive after he has a seizure. A fun day takes a turn at the motocross track that leaves 12-year-old Ollie with a limb-threatening injury. programme.title: Kirstie's House of Craft
programme.desc: Reality TV star Sam Thompson and TV personality Debbie McGee test their craft skills with pretty marbled clay napkin rings

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Two British B&B owners battle with teething problems, an English-run boating company takes a large booking, and a home renovation project is jeopardised when a staircase collapses

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel the length of Britain turning unwanted junk into profit for their owners. In this episode they're on the south coast, where Henry gets to work an aircraft fuel tank while Simon gets obsessed with an iconic 1960s speedboat

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Surrey and Middlesex. Henry restores a pair of racing go-karts to race against restorer Guy, and Simon repurposes an old butcher's block into a coffee table

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers try to track down the relatives of a Liverpudlian woman, and uncover the surprising connection between the site of a Welsh school and a former president of America. Plus, the details of unclaimed estates for which heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B competition heads to France as four British expats compete, beginning with Lisanne Ashton, who runs the rural Les Chimeres in the south of the country. After searching for truffles in the surrounding area, guest Tony Horton's passion for the royal family causes him to clash with fellow competitor Shaun Baggs, whose mood is worsened by the discovery of bugs in his bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Le Manoir in the Dordogne, owned by royalist Tony Horton and his Armenian wife Shou Shou - who make a poor first impression by presenting guests with a timetable specifying when they are allowed to use the bathroom. A vinegar-tasting session also receives a tepid response, and some of the visitors are bemused by their hosts turning up for breakfast in costume

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wine-loving Shaun Baggs and his partner Patrick Weaver bring the contest to Le Clos Rabelais in central France, where they invite fellow competitors to take part in a traditional French dance class. Tension mounts as George and Linda become increasingly frustrated with Lisanne, and the bickering continues over dinner when Shaun is confronted about his previous negative feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: George and Linda McGill welcome their guests to the Moulin de la Civiere near Rostrenen in Brittany, where entertainment comes in the shape of a tenpin-bowling outing, and the couple lay on a full English breakfast. However, the hosts receive an unexpected surprise at feedback time courtesy of Lisanne

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table

programme.title: Love It or List It Australia
programme.desc: Andrew Winter and Neale Whitaker deal with a seaside semi in Sydney's North Bondi area, where a family of five are sharing one bathroom and two bedrooms

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Alex and Danny Moore in Preston, and offer the pair advice on whether they should renovate their home or put it on the market. Danny wants to do up the property and sell it on, but Alex has other ideas, and thinks the house is the perfect place for them to start a family

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Anna and Edward host another big wedding, but Edward is put out of action and with the food delayed and the weather threatening to take a turn for the worse, Anna has to work hard to pull it off without a hitch. Dick visits Tim and Rebecca as they run into structural problems on their second B&B guest suite. With only one guest room up and running, they're in a race against time to double their income by the end of the summer season. Paul tackles a leaking outbuilding to finish the cinema room, while Karen does all she can to bag their first wedding booking

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets artists Indi and Rebecca, who are planning to construct a modern, larch-clad home on the Isle of Skye, with a second hand-crafted building alongside to use as their studio, all on a tight budget of £150,000. They have been saving for years, but making it happen will mean taking on the savage weather, not to mention the sceptical locals - and as if that weren't enough, most of the work is being done by one man, local builder Donald

programme.title: Matt Baker's Travels in the Country: USA
programme.desc: Matt delves deeper into the rural side of Florida life and discovers it is the birthplace of the US cowboy. He visits a citrus farm in Polk County to discover how tangerines are grown and harvested before helping to sort and size them in the pack house. On his journey to Homestead, Matt meets a legendary fruit farmer who explains that Florida also produces a large variety of fruit including the rare guanabana. Matt then heads to Texas to visit the Caprock Canyons State Park

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Two-part special following the case of a naked man found stabbed to death in Luton, which leads police to discover this may be one of a series of murders in which men are lured with the promise of sex, so that they can be robbed. DI Dale Mepstead turns her attention to two men who are seen on CCTV accompanying the suspects into a flat. Will either of the women being held in custody reveal their identity?

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman is airlifted to hospital after being involved in a road traffic collision, with consultants concerned that she may have life-threatening internal bleeding. Meanwhile, 80-year-old Mohammad has come to A&E after falling at home during a family Eid celebratory feast, and 56-year-old Russ is brought in after falling from a ladder while cutting back some trees at work
